jobDescription: DIMP Data Support Analyst  Location: Jackson, MI  Duration: 6 months contract with high possibility of extension Description:Duties:The position is for a highly analytical, critical thinking individual, who will assist in the investigation and interpretation of all measurements associated with the company's Distribution Integrity Management Program (DIMP).The individual will be responsible for all data in relation to the program including but not limited to leak management, cathodic protection and damages.Create and maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.Ensure adherence to client's Distribution Integrity Management ProgramSkills:Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyze significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Be able to communicate your plans, thoughts, and rationale with regulatory compliance and operations.Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data miningMust be proficient in Microsoft Suite and TableauPreferred SAP, Tableau Certified The following skills and experience will set you apart from others: Gas distribution utility related experienceEngineering knowledge and/or experienceGas Distribution ExperienceField ExperienceAbility to work independentlyAnalytical skillsAbility to communicate with all levelsProblem Solving SkillsEducation:Bachelor's degree in engineering, analytics, business, economics, statistics, or data science or minimum 5 years related experience (Minimum Degree Required: Bachelor's Degree) Certifications&Licenses;: Tableau Required Skills:Data AnalyticsData CollectionSAPStatisticsTableau SoftwareAdditional:Data ModelsDatabase DesignDatabasesDesign DevelopmentOperationsProblem SolvingRegulatory ComplianceData ScienceGas Distribution
